result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor J Rennicke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sexual Intercourse with Child 16 or Older, Actor 19 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Counts 1-3: Due during period of probabtion. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

No contact with C.R.G.
Submit to DNA sample.
Case to be expunged upon successful completion of supervision.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

charges.descr: Sexual Intercourse with Child 16 or Older, Actor 19 or Older

miscConds.notes: Same conditions of supervision as Count 1
Same conditions of supervision as Count 1

records.addlTxt: 11:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trevor J Rennicke in court.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Trevor J Rennicke. State gives joint recommendation. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant. Court notes 2 questions not answered on plea questionnaire.  Defendant indicates he is not receiving treatment for any mental illness or disorder.  Defendant indicates he has not had any  consumption of alcohol, medications or drugs in the last 24 hours.  Court accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.

Further proceedings scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on June 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
8:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Maria Penkwitz appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Trevor J Rennicke appeared in court. Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz appeared in court for Trevor J Rennicke. Counsel waives reading and advises efiled waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. 
Court examines Defendant, accepts waiver of prelim, and binds matter over for trial. 
State files the information. 
Counsel requests date for arraignment; advises will be filing request for substitution.
Arraignment scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:26 PM Matthew Nugent appearing for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Trevor J Rennicke appeared by video from Oz County Jail. Attorney Boaz appears in person. Defendant in custody. Counsel appearing as a friend of the court. Counsel advises Defendant does qualify for PD representation and one will be appointed once the criminal complaint is filed. Court finds probable cause. Court reviews charges/penalties. State requesting $5000 signature bond with conditions. Deputy provides copy of PC statement to Defendant. Court orders the victims name in the probable cause statement to be redacted.
Further proceedings scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
No Contact With: C.J., Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
Per Court's direction Probable Cause Statement is available for public to see. Victim's name is redacted.
